subject: Re: Can i do a assertion inside the setUp() method.
msgSnippet: Hi karthikeyand, ... Just try it! JUnit will give you the answer. ;-) protected void setUp throws Exception { ... } # Or are you asking if it is good practice?
messageBody:
Hi karthikeyand,


> When i do a ejb lookup inside the setUp() method of my testcase ,
> can i add a assertion to verify whether the lookup returns a not null
> value. And also can i add a fail in the catch block of the lookup
> code . For eg., can i have it like in the code below..
Just try it! JUnit will give you the answer. ;-)

protected void setUp throws Exception {
> try{
> nctx = new InitialContext();
> hrHome = (HrRemoteHome)PortableRemoteObject.narrow(nctx.lookup
> (hrBean), HrRemoteHome.class);
> assertNotNull("CostCntProjectClient:setup() -> Hr home lookup returned null", hrHome);
>
> hrRemote = (HrRemote)PortableRemoteObject.narrow(hrHome.create(), HrRemote.class);
> assertNotNull("CostCntProjectClient:setup() -> Hr remote lookup
> returned null",hrRemote);
> } catch(CreateException e){
> fail("CostCntProjectClient:setup() -> CreateExceotion "+e.getMessage());
> }catch(NamingException e) {
> fail("CostCntProjectClient:setup() -> NamingExceotion "+e.getMessage());
> }
}

# Or are you asking if it is good practice?


Good luck!

--
Shinobu Kawai <shinobu@..., shinobu@...>
